channel.title: How do I make a .java file?
channel.description: I can only make .txt files, in the .txt file I tried to add import java stuff... name it .java and everything, how do I make it .java?

item.title: How do I make a .java file?
item.dc:creator: @pur3str_pk2 pur3str pk2
item.description:
@pur3str_pk2 wrote:

No talking about rep, lolage

[quote=“Eportal, post:10, topic:69267”][quote author=Eh Pretty Easy link=topic=101772.msg1031831#msg1031831 date=1174429935]
Right click with your mouse on desktop, then there choose New-> Text Document. Then open it and click File. Then click Save As and name it for example Hello.java
[/quote] thats works 2…[/quote]There are different ways to do that.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make a .java file?

@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Right click with your mouse on desktop, then there choose New-> Text Document. Then open it and click File. Then click Save As and name it for example Hello.java

item.source: How do I make a .java file?

item.title: How do I make a .java file?
item.dc:creator: @Eportal Eportal
item.description:
@Eportal wrote:

Uhhhh. Go to your start menu witch is the one you use to turn off your computer, log off, ECT, Then click on Run is your start menu then type cmd a black thing called command prompt should come up. Then type

rename NAME_OF_THE_TXT_FILE.txt NAME_OF_WHAT_U_WANT_IT_2_B.java. By NAME_OF_THE_TXT_FILE i mean that you type the name of the txt file that you want to change and NAME_OF_WHAT_U_WANT_IT_TO_B, change that to the name of the Java file you want to make from the TXT file, then press Enter, and it should rename the TXT file to a JAVA file (= hope it helps.

Read full topic

simple

item.title: How do I make a .java file?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Put the thinngy that says “START MENU”, and click on the thing that looks like a messed up thing that says “RUN”, and put in “C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM32\CMD.EXE” and then apply re-ply #1.
